ygData.subject: RE: Language Impaired
ygData.msgSnippet: Woohoo! Um... hon, i need to talk to you... in Barbarian. Heh. Question #2: I saw on Baelish s site (I think) that the number of typed lines spammed will
ygData.messageBody:
Woohoo!
Um... hon, i need to talk to you... in Barbarian.
Heh.

Question #2:
I saw on Baelish's site (I think) that the number of typed lines spammed
will influence how fast you improve the language skill.
e.g. less lines:

1 /g This is a neat language!

will improve your skill less that if you are spammed the full window of 5(?)
available lines in the hot-key:

1 /g blah vs: 1 /g what
2 /g blah 2 language
3 /g blah 3 am
4 /g blah 4 I
5 /g blah 5 learning?

Is this because each /g command within the script executes a seperate
language check? Thanks.


--
Bahir

"Not knowing the full answer just pisses me off!
Don't give me a "hint" that leads to lost time
and energy that could be spent taking advantage
of stupid people."





-----Original Message-----
From: Mark Stokes [mailto:Mark.Stokes@...]On Behalf Of
mstokes
Sent: Wednesday, December 15, 1999 9:21 AM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Language Impaired


From: mstokes <mstokes@...>

>
>
> Just curious as I have little experience with languages....
> can you increase your language ability by grouping with someone and then
> using group talk to increase skill? The other member of the group won't
get
> anything out of it, I know, but will you?
>
> --
> Bahir
>

Actually, this is the most efficient way of increaseing your language skill.
Just get a group together, and spam eachother in the language you wish to
teach
them. Here's another hint. You can teach a person up to 1 in skill better
than yours, so if you put a point in, you can teach your freind to 2. Then
you
zone. He teaches you to 3. Zone. You teach him to 4. Etc.
